newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Radio Pacific shrholders approve takeover.
newsitem.headline: Radio Pacific shrholders approve takeover.

text.p: Radio Pacific said on Friday its shareholders had voted in favour of the company buying all the ordinary shares in the capital of Energy Enterprises.
Energy is an unlisted company with radio stations in New Plymouth, Tauranga and Hamilton.
Radio Pacific said it had received acceptances of its offer from shareholders owning 90.34 percent of Energy's shares.
A total of 1.54 million shares will be exchanged for Radio Pacific shares, with Energy shareholders receiving six fully paid Radio Pacific shares for every five Energy shares.
Holders of 216,396 Energy shares chose instead to take the cash alternative, receiving NZ$3.60 per share.
